```suggestion
theorem rootsExpandEquivRoots_apply (x) : (rootsExpandEquivRoots p f x : R) = x ^ p := rfl
```
Should this be a simp lemma?

> Should this be a simp lemma?

I'm not sure. As a reference, [frobenius_def](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/CharP/Basic.html#frobenius_def) and [iterate_frobenius](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/CharP/Basic.html#iterate_frobenius) are not simp lemmas.
Yes but this is the coercion of the application. After some more consideration, I think we should make this a simp lemma.

```suggestion
    (rootsExpandPowEquivRoots p f n x : R) = x ^ p ^ n := by
```
Should this be one as well?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(FieldTheory/Perfect): add `rootsExpand[Pow]EquivRoots[_apply]`
